result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alberto A Martinez

Defense states needs new status as defendant is looking into getting into treatment.

Defense is still discussing on resolving this case.
Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on September 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with the victim  (person, property, residence or family). No contact with witness D.B.J. Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.

**AMENDED 7/19/2022:  Defendant to have no violent contact with victim.  Defendant not to threaten, intimidate or talk about this case with victim, no more alleged thefts from the home.  If victim does not want defendant at the home is he is to leave the home.**
Status conference on August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:00 AM Prosecuting attorney Lucas P. Bennewitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Alberto A Martinez in court, in custody.  Attorney Addison R Kuhn in court for Alberto A Martinez. Court Reporter:  Linda Matoska 
Defense requests status, offer received, needs to speak with defendant about this, and also looking into treatment programs.
Defense filed a bond motion in 22CF759, requesting that defendant have contact with his mother.
Victim in court, agrees to have contact with defendant.
State obj.
BTC: As to 22CF759, defendant to have no violent contact with victim.  Defendant not to threaten, intimidate or talk about this case with victim, no more alleged thefts from the home.  If victim does not want defendant at the home he is to leave the home.

11:30 AM Prosecuting attorney Dirk Christian Jensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Alberto A Martinez in court, in custody.  Attorney Addison R Kuhn in court for Alberto A Martinez. Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue. 
Defense moves to modify bond to signature bond in both cases, if cash ordered, requesting no more than $500.
State obj.
BTC: Motion to modify bond denied.  Will reconsider if there is a plan on addressing defendant's substance issues.
Bail/bond hearing on July 1, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Defense.
NG plea entered.
